meanings.definition: A sharp-edged instrument used for shaving or cutting hair.
meanings.sent1: My dad uses razors to shave his beard every morning.
meanings.sent2: The barber carefully handled the razors to give his customer a clean shave.
meanings.sent3: The razors in the bathroom seem to have a mind of their own, always disappearing when you need them.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp as razors, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the razors under the light made them look even more dangerous.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that shaves or cuts closely.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was a real razor, always finding ways to cut costs.
meanings.sent2: The chef's knife was a razor, effortlessly slicing through the vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The razor of a teacher graded the papers with precision, leaving no room for mistakes.
meanings.sent4: His wit was as sharp as a razor, cutting down anyone who dared to challenge him.
meanings.sent5: The razor of a lawyer dissected the witness's testimony, revealing the truth.
